Subject: [Free E-Book] GxP Cloud Adoption Guidelines Whitepaper | Innovating in the Cloud
Content:
The life science industry needs to comply with strict GxP regulations and guidelines on the cloud. "GxP" refers to the "good practice" regulations relevant to the life science industry, and the "x" represents a specific field.

Professionals from Alibaba Cloud and KPMG have joined forces in cloud computing, business acumen, and sector knowledge to provide a complete set of GxP-compliant cloud implementation methods for life science companies, explaining how to operate on the cloud legally and compliantly.

Subject: March 2024 Spotlight: New Models on Kaggle to Check Out
Content:
Hi chase_wchab,
We‚Äôve had a number of models added to Kaggle and encourage you to check them out!
	starcoder2
Publisher: BigCode
StarCoder2, featuring models (3B, 7B, and 15B) trained on 600+
programming languages from The Stack v2, along with data from
Wikipedia, Arxiv, and GitHub issues.
InternLM2
Publisher: Shanghai Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
InternLM2, boasting a 200K context window and showcasing
exceptional abilities in reasoning, math, code interpretation, chat
experience, instruction following, and creative writing.
	c4ai-commander-r-v01
Publisher: Cohere and Cohere for AI
C4ai-command-r-v0, a 35B language model optimized for reasoning,
summarization, and question answering, developed by Cohere
and Cohere For AI.
Try these models out, share notebooks that use the models, and upvote the ones you like. We‚Äôre excited to see what you will build.

Thanks for being part of Kaggle‚Äôs community!

The Kaggle Team

Subject: The story of a 17-year-old Indonesian fintech company
Content:
Echelon X 2024 is the platform to elevate your influence, connect with like-minded professionals, and shape the future of technology. Be a speaker / nominate a speaker.

In this edition of Daily Digest, we have stories about:
After 17 years, DOKU aims to maintain relevance in the Indonesian fintech landscape
GDMC nets US$21M in Series A for its next-gen advanced genetic therapies
Safeguarding Indonesia‚Äôs democracy in the 2024 elections

After 17 years, DOKU aims to maintain relevance in the Indonesian fintech landscape
 
DOKU, an Indonesian fintech startup established in 2007, has successfully navigated the evolution of the payment landscape in Indonesia.

Originally entering the market during a time when cash transactions dominated, DOKU now provides a comprehensive suite of online and offline payment solutions, catering to more than 150,000 merchants across various industries, including notable names like TikTok, Google, Garuda, Prudential, and Traveloka. Over its 17-year journey, DOKU has transformed from a payment gateway into a prominent fintech payment company, offering industry-specific solution products to a diverse clientele.

In an email interview with e27, DOKU Co-Founder & COO Nabilah Alsagoff highlights the company's commitment to addressing the challenges merchants face. By evolving its services in response to the market's changing needs and leveraging comprehensive licenses, DOKU has earned the trust of its clients and positioned itself as a key player in the Indonesian fintech industry.

Find out more about the journey that the company has gone through in this article.

By: Anisa Menur A. Maulani

Subject: SYDNEY Conference with IEEE Publication chance - Deadline extended
Content:
ICECET 2024
IEEE International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Energy Technologies

www.icecet.com

25-27 July 2024
Sydney, AUSTRALIA
If you no longer wish to receive emails from us, please unsubscribe.
Dear colleagues,
Due to many requests, the paper submission deadline has been extended to 7 April 2024. This is the last extension.
Up to now, 720+papers from 80+ countries have been submitted to ICECET. Don't miss the opportunity to participate in this huge evet !
IV. International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Energy Technologies (ICECET 2024) will take place in Sydney, Australia on 25-27 July, 2024. The conference will provide an excellent international forum for dissemination of original research results, new ideas and practical development experiences which concentrate on both theory and practices of the academics, researchers, engineers and also industry professionals.

ICECET 2024 will be held both face-to-face and online. Participants can make their presentations online.

All submissions will be subject to peer reviews and accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore subject to meeting IEEE Xplore's scope and quality requirements.

Please visit the conference web page for more details: https://www.icecet.com
Topics of interest for submission include, but are not limited to:

‚Ä¢ Antennas and Propagation
‚Ä¢ Applied Computer Science
‚Ä¢ Artificial Intelligence
‚Ä¢ Cloud Computing
‚Ä¢ Computer Architecture and Embedded Systems
‚Ä¢ Computer Based Learning
‚Ä¢ Electronic Engineering
‚Ä¢ Energy Saving Technologies
‚Ä¢ Energy Storage Technologies and Devices
‚Ä¢ Energy Transmission and Distribution
‚Ä¢ High Voltage Engineering
‚Ä¢ Human-Computer Interaction
‚Ä¢ Internet of Things and Big Data
‚Ä¢ Networks and Security
‚Ä¢ Photovoltaic Systems and Solar Energy
‚Ä¢ Power Electronics Applications
‚Ä¢ Power Systems and Automation
‚Ä¢ Renewable Energy Systems
‚Ä¢ RF and Microwave Circuits
‚Ä¢ Signal and Image Processing
‚Ä¢ Software Engineering
‚Ä¢ VLSI and MEMS Design
‚Ä¢ Cyber Physical Systems Engineering
If you would like to be a reviewer...
You can review the papers from our conferences and journal. We will send reviewer certificate, after your reviews.
Click here to become a reviewer .
Please feel free to circulate this message among your friends. We would like to send our greetings and looking forward to seeing you in Sydney, Australia.
Paper Submission Due: 7 April 2024
Acceptance Notification: 25 April 2024
Early Bird Registration: 01 May 2024
Camera Ready Submission: 15 May 2024
Registration: 01 June 2024
Conference Dates: 25-27 July 2024

Best regards,
Conference Organizing Team
E-mail: info@icecet.com
Follow us on social media to be informed for our events.

Subject: Got questions about DBS 5 Million Hawker Meals?
Content:
SINGAPORE, HERE‚ÄôS A LITTLE 
SOMETHING FOR ALL OF YOU
We are committed to supporting you as inflation continues to persist, 
and are pleased to share that we‚Äôre extending this initiative 
for another 6 months, till 26 July 2024.
GOT QUESTIONS? WE‚ÄôVE GOT THE ANSWERS!
Not sure how to go about using the hawker meal subsidies? 
Here‚Äôs all you need to know to enjoy it with ease. Time to jiak png!
HERE'S HOW YOU DO IT!

‚ÄúWhat does up to S$3 subsidy mean?‚Äù
You can get a maximum of S$3, which means‚Ä¶


If you pay S$1.50
for your morning kopi,
you‚Äôll get S$1.50 back.


If you pay S$5.50
for your chicken rice,
you‚Äôll get S$3 back.


If you pay S$3
for your kaya toast,
you‚Äôll get S$3 back.
Enjoy a subsidy of up to S$3 on your meal! 
This will be credited directly into your DBS PayLah! account.
‚ÄúCan I redeem every week?‚Äù
Yes, you can as long as you‚Äôre one of the first 100,000 to use PayLah! 
to scan and pay for your hawker meal on Fridays! 
Do note that you can only redeem one subsidy per week.

You‚Äôll be subsidised on your first hawker meal,
so make it count!
‚ÄúHow do I know if the subsidy
is fully redeemed?‚Äù
Check your DBS PayLah! app home screen‚Ä¶

If you see this red banner then it‚Äôs been fully redeemed.
But don‚Äôt worry‚Äîthere‚Äôs always next Friday!
‚ÄúCan I get subsidy at any stall?"
To find participating stalls‚Ä¶
                
Look for an SGQR code
featuring the DBS PayLah! logo.
Look for this DBS PayLah! sticker.
        
                
Visit our website to find
a list of participating stalls.
And be sure to scan the correct SGQR code
to qualify for the subsidy!
‚ÄúDo I need a DBS/POSB account
to get the subsidy?‚Äù
Anyone can get the subsidy!
All you need is a DBS PayLah! account.
Just download and register with your Singpass account.

It‚Äôs that simple!
With all these questions answered, there‚Äôs only one that
remains‚Äîwhat hawker meal will you have this Friday?!
Time to Jiak Png with
Your Ultimate Everyday App
Exclusively for DBS POSB Cardmembers
Monies in DBS PayLah! are a deposit. SGD deposits are insured up to S$75K by SDIC.

Subject: How to Decompress Your Spine
Content:
Gaslighting, AI Spokesmodels, and Jolene  Ten picks for today, curated by our editors. Plus, an eclipse reading list.     
 1      Must Read  How Anti-Vaccine Activists and the Far Right Are Trying to Build a Parallel Economy NPR 
Lisa Hagen  Save 
 
 
 
 2      Good Question  Why Is There so Much Lead in American Food? Vox 
Dylan Scott  Save 
 
 
 
 3      Did a Cat Write This?  Cats Aren‚Äôt Jerks. They‚Äôre Just Misunderstood. The Washington Post 
Colleen Grablick  Save 
 
 
 
 4      Weird History  He Used Plastic Surgery to Raise Rock Stars From the Dead Rolling Stone 
David Browne  Save 
 
 
 
 5      Pop Psychology  So You Think You‚Äôve Been Gaslit The New Yorker 
Leslie Jamison  Save 
 
 
 
 6      Get Up to Speed  How an Automated Spokesmodel Drove the Internet Insane New York Magazine 
John Herrman  Save 
 
 
 
 7      Whole-Body Health  Why Isn‚Äôt Dental Health Considered Primary Medical Care? Knowable Magazine 
Lola Butcher  Save 
 
 
 
 8      Beyond Junk  Five (Legal) Alternative Uses for a Storage Unit Lifehacker 
Jeff Somers  Save 
 
 
 
 9      In the Zeitgeist  The Romantic Rivalry Behind Dolly Parton‚Äôs ‚ÄòJolene‚Äô Mental Floss 
Kenneth Partridge  Save 
 
 
 
 10      Sweet Relief  How to Decompress Your Spine to Reduce Back Ache and Pain Stylist 
Chloe Gray  Save "In Focus  What to Read About the Total Eclipse   Everything You Need to Know About the Upcoming Solar Eclipse  The Verge
Justine Calma  Save 
 Things are going to get a little wacky on April 8th. 
 
 
  The Most Dazzling Eclipse in the Universe  The Atlantic
Adam Frank  Save 
 Anyone who watches the moon glide over the sun this week will be witnessing the planetary version of a lightning strike. 
 
 
  How Do Animals Respond to a Total Solar Eclipse? Scientific American
Meghan Bartels  Save 
 Scientists are finally getting their hands on enough data to begin to understand how animals react to a total solar eclipse. 
 
 
  How to Safely View the Upcoming Solar Eclipse  NBC News
Jesse Kirsch  Save 
 From finding safe glasses to building a pinhole projector." In Case You Missed It      Yesterday‚Äôs Most Read Story  Here Are the Signs You Might Be Sleeping Too Much GQ 
Alex Shultz  Save 
 
 
 
    
 Thanks for reading! If you enjoyed this newsletter, please share it with a friend. Was this email forwarded to you? Subscribe now to get Pocket in your inbox every day.   Take Pocket everywhere

Subject: UMSU General Elections 2023
Content:
UMSU General Election 2023
Have YOUR say!


It‚Äôs that time of year again! The UMSU Annual General Elections for 2023 are just around the corner. It‚Äôs almost time to have your say, but before we do, there are some super important details we need to let you all know about.

üìú Nominations will open on Monday 24 July on the Elections Webpage.
üìß Nominations must be submitted to the Returning Officer by noon (AEST) Friday 11 August.
‚ùî Questions can be sent to the Returning Officer at returningofficer@union.unimelb.edu.au.
‚≠ê Voting will be open from Monday 4 September to Friday 8 September.
The Annual Elections are regulated by the UMSU Constitution and Election Regulations both of which are available here.
All students are eligible to vote, and voting will be conducted online. A series of polling help points will operate on the Parkville, Southbank, and Burnley campuses during election week.
For more information about the elections, check out our Elections Webpage.
Wondering what UMSU really does for you? Learn more about the positions up for election, what student representatives really get up to, and the power of your voice in in your student powered unionHERE!


If you have questions about Elections, please direct them to the Returning Officer via email HERE.


Important: If you know a staff member or elected student representative at UMSU who is not currently recieving these emails, please inform:
communications@union.unimelb.edu.au immediately.


Copyright ¬© 2023 UMSU, All rights reserved.
You're receiving this email because you're an UMSU Member, or because you told us you'd like to find out more about your student union. If you'd like to opt out, just hit the unsubscribe button at the bottom on any of our emails.

Our mailing address is:

UMSU

Wurundjeri and Bunurong Country
Level 4, Building 168, University of Melbourne
Melbourne, Victoria 3010
Australia

Add us to your address book
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.

Subject: Enable Push Notifications to continue using the Citi Mobile¬Æ App
Content:
Dear Customer,

From Apr 2024, kindly ensure that your push notifications are enabled to continue using the Citi Mobile¬Æ App. As part of our continuous efforts to protect you from SMS-related phishing scams, we are introducing this new feature to ensure you receive important service and transactions push notifications from the Citi Mobile¬Æ App.

Some of these important alerts include the following:
PayNow Outgoing Transfer
Credit/Debit Card Transaction Alert
ATM Cash Withdrawal
Online Payments and Transfers on my Bank Account(s)
Account Debit via GIRO & Interbank Transfer
Standing Instructions Debit Alert
Cheque Clearance Alert 
If you had previously opted out of receiving Promotion and Marketing Offers via push notifications, your preference will not be affected by this exercise. However, if you would like to stay abreast of our latest promotions, you have the option to change your preference any time. Simply opt in via the Push Notification button located at the top right corner of the Citi Mobile¬Æ App.



	

To continue using the Citi Mobile¬Æ App,
here‚Äôs how you can ensure you are enrolled:



Benefits of Push Notifications:




Receive notifications from a secure channel


	

Get real-time notifications of your account activities and important updates


	

Retrieve notifications up to the past 6 months from your Citi Mobile¬Æ App inbox




	
				
Never provide your One-Time PIN (OTP) to anyone. Always verify that the OTP you are entering is related to the transaction that you are performing. This includes authorising an online purchase or adding your credit/debit card to your mobile wallet (Apple, Google, or Samsung Pay) or when the SMS OTP is triggered for your Citi Mobile¬Æ App registration.

Citi will never call you to ask for your personal login credentials i.e. User ID & password.

Always check all email, push notification or SMS alerts from Citi relating to your account and report any unauthorised transactions to Citi immediately.

For online security tips, go to Citibank Website and click on ‚ÄúEDUCATION‚Äù at the bottom of the page, followed by ‚ÄúSecurity tips‚Äù.



	
Proud to be your award-winning bank of choice.

Digital Bank of the Year 2023 (Asia Pacific)

(Asia Pacific)
The Asset Magazine
			
#1 Leader Banks (Multichannel) Singapore 2023
#1 Leader
Banks (Multichannel) Singapore

Important Information

Please do not reply to the email as it is auto-generated. To contact us, please log in to the Citi Mobile¬Æ App to send us a message or contact our CitiPhone hotline from 8am and 8pm daily. To report a scam/fraud on your account, please contact us immediately. For our CitiPhone hotline, go to our Citibank website and click on ‚ÄòContact Us‚Äô tab located on the right side.

For full disclaimers and terms and conditions applicable to relevant product and services, go to Citibank Online and click on ‚ÄúBANKING INFORMATION‚Äù at the bottom of the page.

Subject: Hey 88426013, your order is confirmed!
Content:
Hi 88426013,
Thank you for ordering from Lazada!

We‚Äôre excited for you to receive your order #119192562560086 soon and will notify you once it‚Äôs on its way. If you have ordered from multiple sellers, your items will be delivered in separate packages. We hope you had a great shopping experience! You can check your order status here.

Subject: Order #TDB49574 confirmed
Content:
Thank you for shopping with The Daily Blooms!
Hi Ji-An, your order has been received! An email notification will be sent once delivery is in progress. 

On Recipient Details 

Kindly review your recipient details, ensure that the postal code matches with the street address. In case of any changes, do reach out to us as soon as possible at +65 9635 3635. Any street address & postal code discrepancy may be subjected to redelivery charges of $12. 

Please note that any changes to the address after flowers have been confirmed by our courier may be subjected to redelivery charges of $12. 

On Delivery Timings 
For peak periods (Valentine's Day / Mother's Day), delivery is scheduled before 6pm. We apologise in advance that we are not able to accommodate to special timing request. 
For non-peak periods From Monday to Saturday delivery, all orders placed before 12.30pm on the same day is scheduled to be delivered before 6pm. Orders placed after 12.30pm are scheduled before 10pm. 

For Sundays and Public Holidays, orders made before 8.30am on the same day would be delivered between 9-2pm. Orders made after 8.30am would be delivered before 6pm.

Subject: Your recent purchase with your Apple ID
Content:
Dear Ji-An,
Your Apple ID, longja05@gmail.com, has just been used to make a purchase in Wolvesville on a computer or device that has not previously been used. You may also be receiving this email if you reset your password since your last purchase.

If you made this purchase, or have reset your Apple ID password since your last purchase, you may disregard this email.

If you did not make this purchase, or believe someone may have accessed your account, please go to https://appleid.apple.com and change your password as soon as possible.

Sincerely,
Apple
